articles.description: Theo Pinson scored 14 of his 16 points after halftime to go with 10 rebounds, helping No. 14 North Carolina pull away late to beat Notre Dame 83-66 on Monday night.
articles.headline: No. 14 North Carolina pulls away late, tops Notre Dame 83-66

images.caption: Joel Berry II drives in the lane and sinks a floater while drawing a foul to set up a 3-point play for North Carolina.
images.name: Berry falls and scores while drawing foul

articles.description: The Big 12 Conference meat-grinder has taken its toll on Iowa State this season, and it's starting to chew its way through the early frontrunners, one of which was Kansas.
articles.headline: Big 12 tests continue for No. 13 Kansas, Iowa State

articles.description: All season long, No. 7 Texas Tech and No. 23 Oklahoma have been shining examples of two different ways to win games and gain national attention.
articles.headline: No. 7 Texas Tech aims to keep momentum vs. No. 23 Oklahoma

articles.description: Joel Berry II drives in the lane and sinks a floater while drawing a foul to set up a 3-point play for North Carolina.
articles.headline: Berry falls and scores while drawing foul

images.caption: Joel Berry II drives in the lane and sinks a floater while drawing a foul to set up a 3-point play for North Carolina.
images.name: Joel Berry II drives in the lane and sinks a floater while drawing a foul to set up a 3-point play for North Carolina.

articles.description: Michigan State probably needs to win its remaining four games. It needs some help to capture the Big Ten regular-season title after an exhilarating home victory over Purdue on Saturday kept them in the race.
articles.headline: No. 2 Michigan State begins critical road stetch vs. Minnesota

articles.description: Jared Sam scored 18 points and grabbed 15 rebounds to help Southern beat Mississippi Valley State 55-51 on Monday night.
articles.headline: Sam's double-double leads Southern past MVSU 55-51

videos.description: Oklahoma's Trae Young scores the game's first points by driving into the lane and easily getting his floater to drop.
videos.headline: Young opens game with floater

videos.description: Sagaba Konate protects the rim  with a huge rejection that leads to a 3-pointer by James Bolden on the other end for West Virginia.
videos.headline: Konate's huge block sets up Bolden 3-pointer

videos.description: Oklahoma's Trae Young blows past West Virginia's Jevon Carter to get into the paint then finishes with an uncontested lay-in.
videos.headline: Young takes it to the rack

videos.description: Lamont West comes out hot against Oklahoma, draining his first five 3-pointers to give West Virginia a spark off the bench.
videos.headline: Mountaineers' West catches fire from deep

videos.description: The Sooners get the fans at Lloyd Noble Center on their feet as Jordan Shepherd tosses a lob to Jamuni McNeace who throws it down with authority.
videos.headline: McNeace electrifies Oklahoma crowd with alley-oop slam

videos.description: Oklahoma's Trae Young shows off his quick release, pulling up off the dribble and sinking a shot from deep over his defender's outstretched arm.
videos.headline: Young drills contested triple

videos.description: Daxter Miles Jr. drives and dishes to Sagaba Konate who reaches back and slams home a powerful two-handed jam.
videos.headline: West Virginia's Konate throws down the hammer

videos.description: Trae Young scores 17 points on 6-of-9 shooting from the field but doesn't record any assists, and the No. 17 Sooners trail the No. 19 Mountaineers by 10 at halftime.
videos.headline: Young scores 17 in first half

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCB Highlight (Young scores 17 in first half) ESHEET 2018/02/05

videos.description: Oklahoma's Trae Young inbounds the ball to Jamuni McNeace who gives it right back and Young sinks his shot from deep.
videos.headline: Young knocks down corner 3-ball

videos.description: Sooners guard Christian James aggressively drives to the hoop and spins in the lane to get the hoop and the harm.
videos.headline: Oklahoma's James spins into and-1 score

videos.description: As Oklahoma's Trae Young drives to the hoop, Mountaineers guard Jevon Carter strips the ball out of Young's hands to force the turnover.
videos.headline: West Virginia's Carter picks Young's pocket

videos.description: Trae Young shows off his shooting range by burying 3-pointers on back-to-back trips for Oklahoma.
videos.headline: Young hits from deep on two straight possessions

videos.description: Oklahoma's Trae Young dazzles in transition, spinning his contested layup off the top of the backboard and in.
videos.headline: Young uses top of backboard for bizarre basket

videos.description: Oklahoma's Trae Young picks up his first assist late in the second half, driving and passing to Khadeem Lattin who rises up for the slam.
videos.headline: Young dishes sweet wraparound pass for first assist

videos.description: Leading by two points in the final seconds, the Mountaineers force the ball out of Trae Young's hands then protect the rim to hold on for a 75-73 win.
videos.headline: West Virginia defense prevails in wild finish

videos.description: Following a 75-73 win over Oklahoma, West Virginia guard Jevon Carter says the high-level competition of the Big 12 drives him to improve every game.
videos.headline: Carter embraces 'battle' with Trae Young

videos.description: While battling an illness, Trae Young scores 32 points to go along with a season-low one assist, as No. 17 Oklahoma loses to No. 19 West Virginia 75-73.
videos.headline: Young, Oklahoma fall short against West Virginia

tracking.trackingName: NCB_One-Play (Young, Oklahoma fall short against West Virginia) 2018/02/05 ESHEET SOTFULL

videos.description: Fran Fraschilla and Bob Wischusen break down West Virginia's 75-73 win over Oklahoma, crediting Jevon Carter's defense on Trae Young as a key to the victory.
videos.headline: Stout defense lifts Mountaineers past Sooners

videos.description: Despite Trae Young's efforts to fight through illness, the Sooners' star isn't able to lead No. 17 Oklahoma to victory as No. 19 West Virginia takes home a 75-73 win.
videos.headline: WVU finds their swag in victory over Young, Oklahoma

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCB Highlight (WVU finds their swag in victory over Young, Oklahoma) 2018/02/05 ESHEET SCEU
